storyInfo: Ebenholz and Kreide use the Resonanz between their Voice of the Mundane to drive the Originium slugs away, but the shadow of the Witch King still looms over them. The mystery has not yet been solved, and everything points to the tampered-with concert hall.

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Kreide, I'm coming! Stop playing the cello!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Are you trying to get yourself killed?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: That is something I've considered.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I'll draw all the slugs over with the sound of my cello, and then... burn myself to ashes, along with them.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: But now that you're here... I probably won't have a chance to do that anymore.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Kreide, why...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ever since I was little, I knew there was something wrong with me.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: The Infected who spent a lot of time around me... their sickness kept getting worse and worse.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: My grandpa and I were chased out of our home for it. We started wandering between villages.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I always thought, it wasn't all Infected people. That as long as they didn't spend too much time around me, they'd be fine.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: But my grandpa's condition finally started to deteriorate, and that shattered my first illusion.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: After that, Hibiscus told us about the phenomenon of 'false recovery.' I've already caused such serious damage in the short time since I came to the Afterglow.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: If me living brings calamity to others, then I would rather die.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: It's not your fault!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: How is it not my fault?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: ––Do you know about the Voice of Mundane?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Now that you mention it, I... think I'm finally starting to remember.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: About the Voice of Mundane, those who died in the experiment, the Witch King's remains... and you.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I remember it all now.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: That's why none of this is your fault!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Witch King and his remains are to blame, as well as Gertrude – but you're innocent!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Thank you for reminding me that this isn't something I was born with. It was the foul product of an experiment.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I couldn't remember either until I heard the sound of your cello, so I should be thanking you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: 'But' what?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The situation has already spiraled out of control. I can't even mitigate the harm I cause anymore.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Besides, if the Gräfin's words are true, then my days are numbered. I might as well do something here...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: No!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why would I get myself tricked by Gertrude? Voices of the Mundane can be swapped out!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But mine is already corrupted... Even if I were to transfer it to your...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: We won't know until we try!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If you're already prepared to die, then what are you still scared of?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't want to hurt you.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: You can worry about that if something bad actually happens to me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Until then, let's make a wager.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Can you normally feel the melody of the Voice of Mundane?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Whether I'm performing or casting Arts, I can always vaguely feel the presence of the Voice... I know this shrill melody well by now, even though it's not at all mine.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Mine isn't shrill. If anything, it's gentle – Rather, I should say that it's so harmonious, almost to the point of being an empty void.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Let's try our best to match the melodies we've experienced, and put them together.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Put them together...? But we don't have an audience.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: No, look at the audience all around us.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Originium slugs?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Playing to Originium slugs the melodies that the old bastard left behind is quite fitting, if you ask me – humane, even.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.text: As soon as the sounds of flute and cello intermingle, both men immediately recognize the problem.
There is hardly any consonance between their two melodies.
The flute's voice is urgent, manic, and harsh. It speeds up and slows down, as if filled with an urge to drag everything before it into the abyss.
The cello's voice is languid, melancholic, and hollow. Its rhythm remains constant, akin to a land ground down to nothingness by Catastrophe.
But the two brace themselves and persevere, continuing their duet that is not a duet.
The slugs surge forward like the tide.

Underneath a noxious sky, the two men whose lives have been twisted by their Voices of the Mundane continue their discordant duet, reading the score of a melody that they never knew existed in their minds, playing before an audience of Originium slugs.
The more Ebenholz follows this train of thought, the more he feels himself approaching the coda of the Voice of Mundane's melody.
He puts more force behind his breaths, while the sounds of Kreide's cello grow heavier and hollower.

attributes.content: Ebenholz, I...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.text: Ebenholz lowers his head to look towards Kreide. Kreide's head has already begun to droop. His hand continues bowing, but the cello's sound becomes dimmer and dimmer, getting closer and closer to nothingness.
Suddenly, in this moment, Ebenholz seems to realize something.
So, he uses his remaining strength to blow one final sforzando.
Kreide also seems to be struggling, laboriously sawing at the thickest string on the instrument.
Their music spreads like an alarm bell.
The slugs that had been frantically rushing towards the pair of musicians suddenly retreat just as quickly, as if they have seen a predator.

attributes.content: Kreide... Are you still with me...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Kreide, are you still awake?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Draws heavy breaths)
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: ...I'm awake.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: How's that? Can you still hear the melody of your Voice of Mundane?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: To be honest, it seems even clearer now.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Sorry, I acted without thinking.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But on the bright side, we managed to drive away the Originium slugs––
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Hold on...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Kreide, what's wrong?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The new suit you bought for me––
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Oh good, it hasn't been soiled.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Probably doesn't smell too good though, right?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: True enough.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: It's fine. I bet you can't even imagine how much I reek right now.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Speaking of which, this wouldn't be the first time I've gotten myself into this mess.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That time, a fire broke out not far from the Spire of Urtica. Instead of going to put out the fire, the Spire's attendants all rushed over to make sure I couldn't go anywhere.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They were afraid you'd run away?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Afraid that I'd run away, afraid that I'd go into hiding, afraid that I'd die in that sea of fire...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They worried about you dying?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Nearly all the windows in the Spire had Arts-enhanced bars and locks, just in case I tried to jump off.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I was a prized figurehead. If I went off and died, they wouldn't have been able to endure the consequences.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: In the end, the flames never reached the Spire, but I did get marinated in the smell of smoke.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I wore that smoke-soaked coat for a good half month and didn't take it off until the weather warmed.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That brings back old memories here as well.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: After my grandpa and I were run out of our old home, we started to wander between some of the more affluent villages.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Most people were pretty friendly to us, as long as we hid the fact that we were Infected.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I read in novels that during the harvest season, friendly villagers would prepare bratwurst and beer for the day workers at night so that they could eat and drink to their heart's content.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: The friendly villagers threw some spare change at us and shooed us out of the village before nightfall, in fear that we'd steal things.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: The not-so-friendly villagers prepared some rock-hard Schwarzbrot, and pointed weapons at us, intended to make us fall in line.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: One time, I was helping a villager out with some farm work.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: It was really hot that day and I was dripping with sweat, so I wanted to loosen my clothes while nobody was around.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Right before I was about to take off my shirt, I heard a commotion not far away.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Grandpa rushed over and told me to run, saying that one of the workers rolled up his sleeves thinking nobody was watching, accidentally revealing the Originium crystals on his arm.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: The villagers immediately threw him into an abandoned cellar and locked him up, and then set out to check everyone else, one-by-one.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: If not for Grandpa, I might've also died in that cellar.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Died–– They actually kill the Infected?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They didn't need to, nor did they dare.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: All they had to do was wait for them to starve, crystallize, and explode...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Hasn't there been a long-standing law to treat the Infected with dignity?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I never knew about a decree like that until I first set foot in a nomadic city.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm so sorry...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't know what to say.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You have nothing to apologize for. You were also deceived by the Gräfin...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: No, what I mean is, if I had been a little braver back then... If I, if I had spoken up back then, maybe you wouldn't have had to––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Really, you don't have anything to apologize for.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Just as you said, the Voice of Mundane was made by man. The blame falls on those who sought to use the Voice of Mundane, not on you.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I protected you in the manner I could...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Just like you're trying to protect me now.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Thank you, Kreide.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Come, let's find Hibiscus and Herr Czerny... They'll know what to do, I'm sure of it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And then, we'll have that Voice of Mundane removed from you. You can thank me properly after that.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let's go––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Kreide?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Kreide's condition is more or less stable. The reason he passed out most likely has to do with the poison.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: We've rescued a number of poisoning patients whose signs and symptoms largely match with Kreide's.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But on the subject of Kreide's future... the Countess probably didn't lie. Overall, his condition is on the edge of critical.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: So, you'll help us, won't you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I... want to trust the two of you, I really do.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But I need proof.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Even if it's circumstantial evidence, I need some objective facts to show that the Voice of Mundane isn't baseless speculation, but a part of an imminent plot––
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Sir?!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Where've you been? We've been looking all over for you!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Lies? Speculation?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Can you be a hundred percent sure that what you say is true?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: What you said to Kreide... Do you know that he almost died along with those Originium slugs because of your words?!
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Ebenholz, is that true...?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: (Nods slightly)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Had Ebenholz not found him first, you would've never seen him again!
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I'm telling you, the Voice of Mundane is real. That I swear on my life!
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I don't have time to explain it to you right now. I have work to do.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But, I need to...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You're among the most stubborn folk I've ever met.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Go to the lounge of the concert hall, and you'll understand everything.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Right, the concert hall!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Gertrude said she did something to Afterglow Hall to make it match with the Arts during the duet!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Alright, let's go right away–
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: There's also Czerny. Make sure you bring him as well, in case neither of you can convince the other.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I have to go now.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Sir, you...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Ebenholz and Hibiscus trade glances.
They are both suspicious, but they are also running out of time.
